page.title: 16CHALK QUARRIES IN N.FAREHAM
page.content: There is evidence that chalk and flint has been quarried in this area for over 2000 years but the quarries in N.Fareham are of much more recent origin.The rock was used for roadstone to improve turnpike roads,or as a ballast for more modern roads.There is evidence that chalk was used to manufacture building materials such as mortar and flint which can be found as facing in the walls of some houses and boundaries.The modern use of the quarries is as rubbish dumps,both official and unofficial.The official dumps are covered by a metre of clay soil when full,then landscaped with trees and shrubs.The unofficial dumps,containing old beds and rusting cars, have become both unsightly and hazardous.
